titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hettie Bancroft diary, 1866 Feb. 17-1867 Apr. 21
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Entries primarily relate to Bancroft's daily chores and activities, including those of a religious nature. Provides a detailed account of her sister Carrie's death. The family lived in Vermont during the period covered by the diary; by April 1866 they had moved to Bristol, Vt. Also includes a note on the diary by her father, George C. Bancroft, a minister.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Hettie Bancroft diary, 1866 Feb. 17-1867 Apr. 21, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Entries primarily relate to Bancroft's daily chores and activities, including those of a religious nature. Provides a detailed account of her sister Carrie's death. The family lived in Vermont during the period covered by the diary; by April 1866 they had moved to Bristol, Vt. Also includes a note on the diary by her father, George C. Bancroft, a minister.
